name: 10 Days Without Aliens
description:
10 Days Without Aliens is a top-down "sim" where you, a volunteer at an Antarctic signal relay station, just go to work for 10 Days and don't encounter any aliens whatsoever, at all, not even a little...

You and your fellow researchers are simply monitoring signals passing through the Antarctic region when some intriguing visitors arrive...

SPECIAL THANKS TO:

M'lady Kim for listening to and encouraging my weird ideas.

Don Casanova and Isla Hinck for playing a cool alien sim that inspired this story.

Kyle Bosman for making Don't Call Me Momma, But Yes I am Your Momma.

Chris Maltby for an incredible game engine that has fueled so many people's creativity. Download GB Studio today and try creating for yourself!

DEVELOPER'S NOTES:

This is my first video game, made in response to combat boredom during random bouts of excessive free time brought about by COVID-19. The game was made in GB Studio, the art was made in Aseprite, and the music was made in Milky Tracker. I would highly recommend any of these programs to any creators who want to make retro game content.
